summary: This document is a technical guide from T-Mobile explaining how to interpret Call Detail Records (CDR) provided to law enforcement. It details the columns, data formats, time zone considerations (UTC), call types, and location data fields available in their reports. The document appears to be a standard template used for legal compliance.
keyFacts: The document is a T-Mobile guide for law enforcement on interpreting Call Detail Records (CDR).
It specifies that T-Mobile records use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and cannot be converted to local handset time.
The guide details various call types tracked, including voice calls, SMS, and call forwarding.
Location data (cell tower info) is provided for some call types but not for SMS or RCS messages.
The document is a standard procedural guide (version v.170711) and does not contain specific case data or names.
